section_description: This section provides hands-on practice with variables and data types in Python, covering declaration, type conversion, boolean logic, string manipulation, and operations on various data types through interactive coding exercises.
learning_objectives: Students will be able to declare variables and utilize basic data types (int, float, str)
Convert between data types using built-in functions
Apply boolean values and None type in conditional logic
Manipulate strings using formatting and methods
Perform operations on different data types and handle type-specific behaviors

lessons.lesson_title: Declaring Variables and Understanding Basic Data Types
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create variables and identify their corresponding data types using the type() function

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for age (int), price (float), and name (str). Print each variable's value and type using print() and type().
Declare two string variables containing parts of a sentence. Combine them into a third variable and print the result with an exclamation mark at the end.

lessons.lesson_title: Converting Between Data Types Using Built-in Functions
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform explicit type conversion between numeric and string types using Python's built-in conversion functions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that takes user input as a string, converts it to both integer and float types, and prints the converted values with their original input.
Create variables with mixed types (e.g., '123' and 45.67). Convert them appropriately to perform addition operations and display the results.

lessons.lesson_title: Working with Boolean Values and None Type
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create and evaluate boolean expressions while understanding the role of None in Python
key_topics: Truthiness evaluation of different data types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write expressions to check if a number is positive and even, or if a string is empty. Print the boolean results of each condition.
Create a function that returns None when given invalid input. Test it with different values and check for None using is operator.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to format strings using f-strings and apply common string methods to manipulate text data

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a program that takes user input for name and age, then generates a formatted greeting using f-strings that includes both values.
Write code that converts a sentence to uppercase, splits it into words, and joins them with hyphens between each word.

lessons.lesson_title: Performing Operations on Different Data Types
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform arithmetic operations on numbers and concatenation operations on strings while handling type-specific behaviors
key_topics: Arithmetic operations on integers and floats
Operator precedence with multiple data types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Calculate the area of a circle using radius input from user. Handle both integer and float inputs for accurate results.
Combine numeric and string operations to create a program that calculates total cost and displays it with a formatted message.
